Increased privacy concerns as people are concerned about their mental privacy and the possibility of surveillance.
Increased competition as people can now compete on record speeds and quality of their dreams.
Increased productivity as people are now more efficient in their dream work due to the increased accessibility of dream recordings.
Increased creativity as people can now create more interesting and engaging dream worlds.
Increased anxiety as people become concerned that they are not in control of their dreams and that their dreams will be revealed to the public.
